snippet: A baby bird in the Amazon rain forest has downy feathers with long, orange barbs and white tips that make it look like a poisonous hairy caterpillar, researchers are reporting.
abstract: Gustavo Londono study in journal The American Naturalist reports that baby bird in Amazon rain forest, called cinereous mourner, has downy feathers with orange barbs and white tips that make it look like poisonous caterpillar, helping it to avoid predators.
lead_paragraph: A baby bird in the Amazon rain forest has downy feathers with long, orange barbs and white tips that make it look like a poisonous hairy caterpillar, researchers are reporting.

headline.main: Mimicking a Caterpillar to Avoid Detection
headline.print_headline: Birds: Mimicking a Caterpillar to Avoid Detection
